question.questionText: Andi and Scott decided to investigate solar water heaters using collectors of different colors (but the same size) as one variable and covered versus uncovered as a second variable. Look at the graph of their data and answer the questions below. What does the graph tell you about the effect of using blue versus red collectors?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Solar water heaters with blue collectors heat up faster than solar water heaters with red collectors.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Blue is very attracted to the heat whether it is covered or not. Red is not attracted.
Blue will get hotter because it is a dark color and red is not.
The blue absorbs most of the sun and red did not absorb most of the sun.
That blue it is more dark than red.
The blue covered got hotter and in the same amount of time than the red.
Blue versus are warmer than red versus.
Blue is more darker so it absorbs more heat and that is why it is bigger.
It warms better.
That the blue will heat up faster than the red because the blue is darker.
Because the blue uncovered and the red covered is like the same like the blue uncovered.

Because blue uncovered does not attract that much heat like the red one does.
The blue collects more heat, because it is more darker than red.
The blue color is kind of a color black and darker than red so that why the blue heat more than the red one.
The blue gets hotter than the red maybe because the blue is darker than the red.

Blue heats water better.
It is more better than using other colors.

It tells me that the blue collectors heat up faster than the blue collectors.
